json.text: Hi, my name is Mick. Hi, my name is Nieke.
In this video we will demonstrate the properties of Kangen Water and show why it is so good for your health.
‘Kangen’ means ‘back to the source’ and stands for water in its most pure, healing form.
Water is said to be the essence of life and is indeed essential for our health.
We are composed of about 70% water and that’s why drinking enough water of the right quality is very important for our health.
Kangen Water has got several properties that our body can use to restore itself.
It is alkaline, rich in anti-oxidants and micro-clustered.
These are exactly the things that your body uses to restore itself.
We will now explain what this means.
ANTI-OXIDANT
First: oxidation – this we recognize when we cut open an apple or a banana or an avocado,
which turns brown after reacting with the air.
Or if you leave your bike outside too long, in the rain, in reaction with the air it will rust.
This also happens in our body, in our cells and tissue.
Through natural energy burning processes, but it is accelerated by an unhealthy lifestyle.
Think of unhealthy food and drinks, but also radiation and stress.
Because of this, free radicals are created.
So we need anti-oxidants to reverse that process.
These are found, among other things, in vegetables and fruits,
but often not enough to reverse all these negative influences.
Kangen Water is very rich in anti-oxidants.
Through the ionization process an abundance of free electrons are donated to the water,
as well as active hydrogen gas.
This is immensely effective in reversing free radical damage.
I am going to perform a few tests to demonstrate this.
I will pour a few drinks here, the likes of which we’ve all had before.
This is Spa Blauw, mineral water.
Spa Rood, it's carbonated. Do you ever drink this with your food?
This is often perceived as a healthy alternative.
7 Up, which stands for all sodas, sports drinks and energy drinks.
We will see in a minute what this does with your body
This is tap water, just got it from the tap.
Finally, I’ve got Kangen Water here and I will pour this in the last glass.
Now, here I’ve got a ORP meter,
from a laboratory, haha no, an aquarium shop,
because fish are obviously very sensitive to their water.
If this value turns out positive, it means that it has a oxidizing effect and is bad for our body.
If it turns out to a negative value, it means it is anti-oxidizing and is good, healing for our body.
Alright, I’ve poured several drinks here.
First of all, Spa Blauw.
Well, we are now seeing the ORP meter show that we have a positive value of about 300 in the air.
This is because it is reacting to the oxygen.
Now, the Spa Blauw.
You can see it is going to 350,
360, 370 even and a little bit more.
Spa Rood rises a little bit further to 410, towards 414.
Well, I don’t know if you ever drink this with your dinner?
7 Up shows 430 even.
It varies a bit but stabilizes at a given point. It's 425 now.
Our local tap water.
It decreases a bit. That’s no surprise. It stabilizes around 360 - 350.
Alright, now Kangen Water.
I’m not sure if you can see this, but what’s happening is that it is reversing rapidly.
50 positive, but it’s minus now.
It will even go back further.
So this is the reason we say Kangen Water is rich in anti-oxidants
and is very good for body to drink.
ALKALINE
The pH (potential of Hydrogen) value of various drinks can be measured.
We have put out the same drinks here for you.
You can measure this for example with these drops. These are used for aquariums
and you can test pool water with it too. It’s important that these have the right pH.
I’m putting some drops in each drink so we can see what the difference is.
In the meantime I’d like to explain:
the pH scale is logarithmic…
I’ll just put a few more so it’s clear on film…
A logarithmic scale means that
7 is 0, neutral. 6 is 10 times as acidic as neutral.
5 is a 100 times as acidic. 4 is a 1000 times as acidic. And 3 is 10.000 times as acidic.
And when we look at this, with this one you can see it’s about 6.
This is also what it says on the label.
Spa Rood is going all the way to this side.
Spa Rood has a pH of about 3.
What did we say? That’s 10.000 times as acidic as neutral.
Then we’ve got 7 Up.
Not that different from Spa Rood even, the pH is about 2.7.
This is tap water.
Tap water turns out blue.
Well, actually it would have been more on this side, but they put chemicals in,
because otherwise the water pipes would corrode.
And last but not least: Kangen Water, which has a very nice purple color.
It has a pH of 9.5, which is very clearly visible.
To neutralize one glass of 7 Up,
you need 500 glasses of tap water or 32 glasses of Kangen Water.
I can show you this. I will pour this in here. Nothing happens at all to the color.
I’m pouring it into the Spa Rood and you see some blue happen,
because it’s water and wants to react with it, but the carbon causes nothing to happen.
Spa Blauw takes on the alkaline property fairly quickly.
If we would reverse this…
I’ll pour a small cap of 7 Up in here.
You see it slowly fade…
and now it’s… tadaaa.... acidic.
MICRO-CLUSTERED
Another type of special water which the machine makes is pH 11.5.
This is created together with the strong acid water, the pH 2.5.
The 11.5 I’ve got here in a container because I keep it in the fridge [to make it even stronger].
It has the property that it emulsifies oils. It works very well for cleaning our vegetables and fruits.
I’m going to pour some in here with the tomatoes.
These are just conventional tomatoes from the supermarket.
Well, we wash these often before use, because we know they can be dirty.
Maybe pesticides too, which are on everything that is not organic.
And even on produce that is organic, can be pesticides. We want these off, so we wash it.
We will see what happens when washed with tap water versus Kangen Water 11.5.
I’m going to let this soak and we will check in about 5 minutes what has happened.
I will continue right away with a test that demonstrates the micro-clustering of the water.
I brought some tea for this purpose.
We all know water is H2O. But these molecules live in groups, in clusters.
Normal water has about 15 to 20 molecules together.
But Kangen Water after ionization is micro-clustered and has 5 to 6 molecules together.
Why is this important?
Because it can reach your cells much easier with nutrients
and can also remove waste products from your body. So it’s very good for detoxification.
This might sound a bit vague, so I’ll demonstrate it.
I’ve got some regular Lipton green tea,
and I’ll pour some tap water with it.
We all recognize that with cold water it’s not possible to make tea very well.
The molecules are too big to extract the taste and smell from the tea leaves.
I’m just grabbing some more Kangen Water…
Let me drain this tea bag
When I pour Kangen Water in here…
Well, I can already smell it, but I believe you can also see it on camera:
it gets a whole different color with Kangen Water.
I could repeat this test several more times, but fact is that this water is different.
Let me just put this aside…
I’m going to have a look whether our tomatoes are ready yet.
Let me stir them a bit more.
We need some cups here
These are the tap water tomatoes. What are we removing from this?
Not so much.
Here are the Kangen tomatoes.
They were just in for a little bit. And we already see a big difference in colour.
I’m not sure if you can see this (on my shirt). Yes, I need to put them like this.
What we are seeing here is that the pesticides came off from the vegetables and fruits.
And you can taste this too. Most people notice an improved taste, less acidic.
You can also see it on the surface of the fruit and vegetables.
It’s really the ideal way to prepare your fruits and vegetables.
WOULD YOU LIKE TO KNOW MORE?
This concluded our presentation about Kangen Water by Enagic.
We hope we have given you the right information,
so you can make your own well-informed decision about your water.
If you have questions, you can always send a message to the person who sent you this video.
Or you can go to KangenWater-Nederland.nl. From there you can send us a message as well.
